headline_1: Many Cities Say Yes to Federal Police Help, but No to ‘Occupation’
paragraph_1: Some officials said they would welcome more traditional law enforcement cooperation with federal agents, but see the National Guard as a step too far.
headline_2: Grand Juries in D.C. Reject Wave of Charges Under Trump’s Crackdown
paragraph_2: The persistent rejections suggest that the grand jurors may have had enough of prosecutors seeking harsh charges in a highly politicized environment.
headline_3: Chicago Braces for a Surge of Federal Agents

headline_1: How Trump’s Blunt-Force Diplomacy Is Pushing His Rivals Together
paragraph_1: Some of President Trump’s pressure tactics appear to have backfired, sending would-be allies into the embrace of China.
headline_2: In India’s Rebound From Trump Blows, Modi Has No Easy Choices
paragraph_2: The unraveling of relations has convinced many Indian officials that the country should return to its difficult balancing act of nonalignment.

headline_1: At George Mason University, Trump Has Found an Unbending Adversary
paragraph_1: Gregory Washington, George Mason’s first Black president, runs a university that prizes diversity. That has made him a target of the Trump administration.

headline_1: Thrust Into the Line of Fire, Iranians Worry About What Comes Next
paragraph_1: We visited Tehran and talked to Iranians living in the aftermath of the 12-day war with Israel in June. Some want to strike back, others want to move on.

headline_1: Humans Are Altering the Seas. Here’s What the Future Ocean Might Look Like.
paragraph_1: Some marine ecosystems could soon be unrecognizable, according to new research. We mapped the possibilities.

headline_1: How a Top Secret SEAL Team 6 Mission Into North Korea Fell Apart
paragraph_1: The 2019 operation, greenlit by President Trump, sought a strategic edge. It left unarmed North Koreans dead.

headline_1: Davey Johnson, Who Managed the Mets to a Surprising Title, Dies at 82
paragraph_1: Before his triumph in the 1986 World Series, he had a long playing career and established himself as one of baseball’s brainier and more self-assured characters.

headline_1: Jannik Sinner and Carlos Alcaraz Each Took Their Own Path to the U.S. Open Final

headline_1: Bernie Sanders Stumps for Zohran Mamdani in Bid to Energize Progressive Voters

paragraph_1: A plan to buy warships shows how Europe is bolstering defenses amid worries about Russian aggression and President Trump’s isolationist policies, analysts say.

paragraph_2: Weather patterns channeling moisture into the state have led to an abundance of lightning strikes that have ignited hundreds of wildfires.
